TopicTitle: Rocks and rock formations on the mun?

Articles.Content:
Okay, perhaps I\'m late as hell on the ball here, but I\'ve searched a bit and found nothing.

I thought that the Mun would be a barren, flat place, but there are some geological formations that are separated from the rest of the surface. I found this large arch at the coordinates: Lat 12.421784, Long: 39.171446.

This structure is solid, unlike some rock I found a week ago that I just clipped through with my wheeled explorer.

Any other nice places to go sightseeing? :-)

Hi Badimo.

The rocks turned up in 0.14.3 (I think) and the arches are new to 0.15.

There are other things to find and I don\'t want to give too much away as it would spoil things for you, but there is another space center *somewhere* on Kerbin, and very strange, somewhat small objects scattered across the Mun, Kerbin and I heard there is even one on the new moon.

I won\'t say any more, but now you have a reason to go exploring.

Also, welcome to the KSP community ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thank you! 

So then it\'s not my copy of KSP that has bugged out, atleast ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

More things to find is awsome, great to have something to strive for, except putting 100 ton space stations in orbit and landing a rolling moon lab on minimus!

I don\'t know why people think exploring all of Kerbin is something special and that it\'s a \'Snape Kills Dumbledore\' spoiler.

The other KSC is easy to find on Kerbin - the \'return to KSC\' indicator on the nav ball is pointing right to it.

> 
> I don\'t know why people think exploring all of Kerbin is something special and that it\'s a \'Snape Kills Dumbledore\' spoiler.
> 
> The other KSC is easy to find on Kerbin - the \'return to KSC\' indicator on the nav ball is pointing right to it.

Snape kills Dumbledore!? ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

 ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Some people like the challenge of *finding* these things, I personally have ruined too many games by reading walkthroughs when things got tough, so I try to avoid spoiling the sense of exploration and discovery that a new and unknown game can provide.

Course, if you want spoilers badly enough you can probably find everything via google ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Edited for spelling.

To spoil even more...

> 
> There are several devices available in *Addon Releases* section that help locating these thingys. Devices output vary from 'beep-beep' as you approach the thingy -- and up to giving you exact location of the nearest one 
> ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> Some people like the challenge of *finding* these things, I personally have ruined too many games by reading walkthroughs when things got tough

Yeah, I\'m positive everyone who found the other KSC did it by examining every square foot of Kerbin, and not just because one or two guys stumbled across it and told everyone else :![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Nah I think quicker people than me did it by following the Navball just like you said, I had to make do with some vague directions and peering at Kerbin in the map screen for ages trying to guess where it might be, I didn\'t cotton on to the Navball marker till later.

Also, Badimo, next time you are launching a rocket or spaceplane, take a look to the north, it\'s small but there is something *interesting* over there, and that\'s not the only one ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> ....and I heard there is even one on the new moon.

While this may be correct enough for someone to find it, this is not technically correct.
You are correct, but to phrase it incorrectly would give too much information away correct?

> 
> Snape kills Dumbledore!? ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)
> 
>  ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Aw dangit. I still haven\'t seen that one yet. But I\'ll get you back! 

> 
> Darth Vader dies at the end of Jedi. Mwhahaha!
